result.execSummary:
The defendant Solvaline Renee Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:10  This includes 14CM176 and 14CM57.  Defendant Solvaline Renee Brown in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie - Plead to 14CF130 Ct 2  Dism Ct 1  14CM57 reopen and dismiss.  14CM176 dismiss.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  . Thorie amends the charge Ct 1  of 14CF130 to Poss of narcotic drugs (remove party to a crime)  Probation 1 year.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to amended  Ct 2 Poss of narcotic drugs.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the amended CT 2 poss of narcotic drugs. 14CM57 reopen and dismiss the case.  14CM176 Dismiss case.  14CF130 Ct 1 dismiss.  Ct 2  S/W Prob 1 year  Conditions  $265.court costs and DNA sample and surcharge of $200.00  Appeal rights are given to the defenant.
Plea hearing at 05-19-2015 03:45 pm.

10:49 Defendant Solvaline Renee Brown in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CM176 heard at this time. Thorie: set this matter out to work on a resolution. Chapman agrees. Court: approves. Def to remain until she is handed a notice of hearing.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.    Defendant enters not guilty plea to both counts 1 and 2 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  The bond will continue as ordered.  Set Pre Trial Conference to coincide with 14CM176.

9:37 a.m.  Defendant Solvaline Renee Brown in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Defendant Solvaline Renee Brown in custody.  Sean E. Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.    Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
